items.album: Vejación de la Bestia / Fosa Común
items.description: Chemical grinding black/death assault from Panamá!!!!
items.label: Dunkelheit Produktionen

items.description: Great album of this cult italian band. Horror doom in its purest form, catchy and creepy as hell. A must.
items.label: Terror From Hell Records

items.description: New album of the horror doom masters! Great as usual, maybe even better than Feretri. Includes a nice Bedemon cover!
items.label: Terror From Hell Records

items.description: Magyar Black Metal with melodic touches and grim atmosphere.
items.label: Paragon Records

items.description: Classical recording of the most prolific band ever. Recorded back on 1997 on request or Mr. Peel himself.
items.label: Selfmadegod Records

items.album: Om Ah Hum Vajra Guru Padma Siddhi Hum
items.description: Debut full-length of this french death metal band. Cryptic, heavy, dark and twisted.
items.label: Iron Bonehead Productions

items.description: Brand new album of Black Funeral, one of the first american black metal bands. Pure black metal!
items.label: Iron Bonehead Productions

items.album: Nothing New — 10 Years Of Fresh Air Enjoyment
items.description: Compilation of stuff previously released only in splits, samplers etc. of this german band.
items.label: Metamatter Records, Wolfbiker Records

items.description: Don't let the title of this album mislead you, this is not death metal, but proper doom with a heavy (yet groovy) edge. For fans of Hellhammer, Dream Death, Witchfinder General...
items.label: Barbarian Wrath

items.description: One of the most renowned bands in the black/death underground of the last years. This is their first MCD, probably their best material up to date
items.label: Iron Bonehead Productions

items.description: Very strange recording... kind of electronic / industrial metal with some catchy vocals... not for me, it lack balls. Topillo clubbers may enjoy it, though.
items.label: Altsphere Production

items.description: Debut album of this good greek band. Similar to Black Sabbath, with twin guitars (more a la british heavy metal) but with kind of a stoner sound.
items.label: Twin Earth Records

items.description: Second album of this great band from Motril and beyond. Way better and more diverse than the first one. Includes poster!
items.label: Discos Macarras

items.description: I like this band very much! Classical doom from Finland, I thought they were mere Reverend Bizarre worshippers but they are actually good.
items.label: Shadow Kingdom Records

items.description: Debut CD of this german band, sludge a la Weedeater, Noothgrush, etc.
items.label: Meta Matter Records

items.description: Latest CD of this portuguese doom band. This time with some 70s touches, but still heavy... their best album up to now.
items.label: Ragingplanet, At War With False Noise

items.description: Doom/Death from UK, with members of Gallow God. Please note that it's not whiny stuff, it has good DOOM riffs.
items.label: Weird Truth Productions

items.description: Black Metal with pagan spirit from Spain. In the vein of Taake, Immortal or Windir.
items.label: Vertebrae

items.description: Monstrous sludge from this frenchmen! Sounds good.
items.label: Aesthetic Death Records

items.description: Repress of the debut album of this epic metal band, with members of Isole. This record is a true gem, following the path taken by Bathory at their viking era but with a more doomy sound.
items.label: I Hate Records

items.description: Second album of this band from Austria. Dirty Black / Speed / Rock n roll etc.
items.label: Discos Macarras, Música Híbrida

items.album: Drowned In An Unknown Meaning Of Life And Death
items.description: Chilean death / doom, creepy and dark as hell. Chile usually delivers nice dark music and this is no exception.
items.label: From the Grave Records

items.description: Debut album of this italian traditional doom metal band.
items.label: Solitude Productions

items.description: Last album of this rather unknown french doom band.
items.label: Aesthetic Death Records

items.album: My Journey Is Ending But The Torment Will Be Eternal
items.description: Cold and canonic black metal with tremolo riffing, hateful atmosphere and all the things you would expect from a black metal release.
items.label: Paragon Records

items.description: Re-issue of the 2001 comeback album of this legendary band from Norway.
items.label: Solitude Productions

items.description: Opressive and asphyxiating doom/death from France, with members of Ataraxie. This is their latest album so far, almost 90 minutes of extreme, crushing and desperate doom. Not for the weak.
items.label: Weird Truth Productions

items.description: Ambient / dark / doom of this russian outcasts. Not easy to listen, but inspiring.
items.label: Aesthetic Death Records

items.description: Dark electronic music, opressive sounds. Handle with care.
items.label: Aesthetic Death Records

items.description: As the label says: "Dark visitations from syncopated, hypnotic, lysergic and erotic rites - musick and magick are intertwined and explored."
items.label: Aesthetic Death Records

items.description: Latest album of this italian band (located in Sweden, though). Great as expected, with evil flutes, female vocals, etc.
items.label: Terror From Hell Records

items.description: Stoner/Doom from Italy a la Electric Wizard but with softer vocal melodies and without the 'bad trip' vicious sound. Nice, relaxing and weed-friendly music.
items.label: Twin Earth Records

items.description: Debut CD of this incredible epic doom metal band from England!!! We're so proud of having them in our Topillo Family. If you like Warning, Revelation, or Mirror of Deception, you will like this!
items.label: Topillo Records

items.description: Twisted and furious Death/Black metal. Imagine a fast-paced, extreme sounding version of Voivod's mid-career albums with an atmosphere similar to last Bloody Sign CD. Killer!
items.label: Necroshrine Records

items.description: Cult 1992 demo of this hungarian crossover band. Recommended for freaks of hungarian crossover bands, goulash, etc!
items.label: Metal Ör Die Records

items.description: Brand new MCD of these australian motherfuckers. One of the best doom bands that I've heard in years!! Three new studio songs and four rehearsal bonus tracks. Powerful, furious and classic doom. A must for every fucking doom-freak!!!
items.label: Topillo Records

items.description: Brand new MCD of these australian motherfuckers. One of the best doom bands that I've heard in years!! Three new studio songs and four rehearsal bonus tracks. A must for every fucking doom-freak!!! Includes a nice yellow shirt... discretion is for suckers!
items.label: Topillo Records

items.description: Yellow ultra-limited shirt of these australian diablos. Not for sissies.
items.label: Topillo Records

items.description: ARRRGHHH!!!! Maybe the best album of the Wichita legends? I don't know, but I enjoy every single track... buy it!!!
items.label: Shadow Kingdom Records

items.description: Another 80s gem from Manilla Road, great as usual!!!!
items.label: Shadow Kingdom Records

items.description: This doesn't have anything to do with metal. It's more like an ambient release, for the moments of introspection.
items.label: Aesthetic Death Records

items.description: Compilation CD of Misty Grey, including their EP "The Third Man" and their demo "Demon". A bit rawer than the debut CD but still great dooooom.
items.label: Metal Ör Die Records

items.description: Traditional doom metal with creepy female vocals from Madrid. For fans of Pentagram, Witchfinder General or Reino Ermitaño. Arguably, the best doom album ever recorded in Spain.
items.label: Out of the Past, Vertebrae, Topillo Records

items.description: Interviews with Disembowelment, 13, Grief, Ride For Revenge, Asphyx, Dennis Dread, etc. Plus some nice articles about belgian beer, bizarre porn, etc. One of the best and bleakest fanzines from Spain, no doubt about that, with an unique aura of negativity. Written in spanish so be careful before ordering.
items.label: Self-released

items.description: Two long songs by this dark and heavy band. Horror doom from the South of England.
items.label: At War With False Noise

items.description: First full-length of this punkish doom metal band from Rome.
items.label: BloodRock Records

items.description: This is one of the most extreme sounding doom records I've heard, and I've heard lots of them. Pure despair, the cover says it all.
items.label: Aesthetic Death Records

items.description: Old-school grindcore from Poland, very much in the vein of Repulsion.
items.label: Selfmadegod Records

items.description: Debut album of this great band from Bulgaria! Powerful true doom sound, a la Reverend Bizarre.
items.label: Solitude Productions

items.description: Extreme death/doom, right from the deepest cavern in the fucking world. Very heavy and opressive.
items.label: Aesthetic Death Records

items.description: Finally available the second full-length of these death metal maniacs from Cuenca (Spain). If you like your Death Metal being rooted in the ancient sounds, try this.
items.label: Equinox Discos

items.description: Not to be confused with spanish Ortega Cano. Post sludge or whatever is called, not my favourite music to be honest.
items.label: Aesthetic Death Records

items.album: Spreading My Wings Into The Abyss That Calls
items.description: Crude black metal from the UK inspired by the lunar nightsky, nebular landscapes and the stench of death.
items.label: Equinox Discos, Sinister Stench Productions, Werewolf Promotion

items.description: Great EP of this band from Madrid. A bastard mixture of south american and spanish heavy metal with a strong vibe of speed / punk and social lyrics. By the way, catch them live if you can, they won't disappoint you.
items.label: Discos MeCagoEnDios

items.description: Good female-fronted retro doom/stoner/occult rock. This band is getting a lot of attention, and I can see why!
items.label: Twin Earth Records

items.description: Latest album of the best thrash band around, no doubt. Pure 80s worshipping of these finnish maniacs. Anti-intellectual speed/thrash metal.
items.label: Witches Brew

items.description: Fucking great funeral doom album of these czechs. Church organ worshipping a la Skepticism, etc.
items.label: Moscow Funeral League, Solitude Productions

items.description: More grindcore madness from these brazilian freaks. Brand new EP, released in 2016.
items.label: Selfmadegod Records

items.description: Although Rote Mare used to be a one-man project, now it's a full true doom band. Twisted and demented stuff from Australia.
items.label: Rotedoom Records

items.description: Second album of this spanish band of sludge / alternative doom.
items.label: Odio Sonoro, Discos Macarras, Nooirax Producciones

items.description: Traditional doom from Finland, sharing vocalist with The Wandering Midget. Great album with haunting choruses and lots of respect to classic doom metal sound.
items.label: I Hate Records

items.description: Reissue of the already classic debut album of Starchild, great stoner/doom a la Sleep etc. Twin Earth delivers!
items.label: Twin Earth Records

items.description: Classic doom metal with good intentions but a bit weak results. Anyway, enjoyable album with some nice parts.
items.label: Altsphere Production

items.description: Re-stock of this great album! For me, one of the best (if not the best) epic doom records in the last ten years or so. Great guitar melodies, great vocals, great songs, great EVERYTHING.
items.label: I Hate Records

items.description: Second album of this australian black/death group. The adjectives opressive or cavernous may be cliches, but fit their music pretty accurately. Fucking chaos from the depths.
items.label: Iron Bonehead Productions

items.description: Strange mixture of black metal and some '-core' things with asphyxiating and bizarre atmosphere.
items.label: Aesthetic Death Records

items.description: Latest album of this Slovenian band. Vocals a la Venom and dirty sound, but the music is more elaborated and closer to classic heavy metal that your average speed/black band.
items.label: Witches Brew

items.album: A Journey Through The Twelve Hours Of The Night
items.description: Great demented sludge / drone with scary vocals a la Burning Witch, recommended.
items.label: Meta Matter Records, Wolfbiker Records

items.description: Interesting band from the minds behind Insulters. Here they play a mix of Black/Death/Rock n roll with some doomy touches.
items.label: Equinox Discos

items.description: Doom metal from Bogotá, Colombia (they label themselves as "doom metal from the third world"). Presented in a very nice looking digisleeve this band delivers 30 mins of raw classical doom metal. Includes patch and sticker.
items.label: Rotten Leather Prods, Saviour Records, Necrowolves

items.description: Short-lived band from France, they released this nice demo some years ago and now Shadow Kingdom re-releases it. Good!
items.label: Shadow Kingdom Records

items.album: A Gaze Blank and Pitiless As The Sun
items.description: More darkness from Aesthetic Death Records.
items.label: Aesthetic Death Records

items.description: Sludge band from the UK, in the vein of the mighty Iron Monkey but of course not reaching their grandness.
items.label: Altsphere Production

items.description: Funeral doom classic, I'm pretty sure most of you are familiar with this album.
items.label: Weird Truth Productions
